author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Karur police have formed four special teams to nab the accused in a suspected case of ‘honour’ killing that took place on Saturday.

Suresh alias Arockiasamy (28) of Ramagoundan Pudur was hacked to death inside a liquor bar by four persons for marrying a woman, Gajapriya, belonging to a different caste.

One of the accused, S. Sivanesan (22), is the woman’s younger brother.

A senior police officer told The Hindu that a case under Section 302 of the Indian Penal Code had been registered against four persons.

According to the officer, Suresh had fallen in love with his house owner Santhanam’s daughter a few years ago.

The two had eloped and lived together for a few weeks but Gajapriya’s parents managed to bring her back .

“Suresh had then sent some photographs of his with Gajapriya to her brother on WhatsApp and warned him against arranging a remarriage for her. We suspect this led to the murder,” the officer said, when specifically asked if this was a case of “honour” killing.

Meanwhile, the body of Suresh was handed over to his parents after post-mortem at the Karur Hospital.

It was taken to his native village of Vaiyampatty in Dindigul district for last rites.

The deceased had warned his wife’s brother against arranging her remarriage: police
title: Special teams formed to nab ‘honour’ killing accused
